title: Aloe
description: Aloe vera is a succulent plant known for its thick, fleshy leaves that contain a gel-like substance. It has been used for centuries for its medicinal properties.
uses: Aloe vera is commonly used in skincare and beauty products due to its hydrating and soothing properties. It is also used to treat minor burns, skin irritations, and as an ingredient in various health supplements.

title: Burdock
description: Burdock is a biennial plant that produces large, heart-shaped leaves and purple-pink flowers. Its root is the most commonly used part for its medicinal and culinary purposes.
uses: Burdock root is used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits. It is believed to have anti-inflammatory properties and is used to support healthy skin, digestion, and as a diuretic. It's also used in culinary dishes in some cultures.

title: Calendula
description: Calendula, also known as marigold, is a bright and cheerful flowering plant with yellow or orange petals. It has been used for its therapeutic properties for centuries.
uses: Calendula is often used in herbal remedies and skincare products for its anti-inflammatory and skin-soothing properties. It is commonly used in creams, ointments, and oils to help alleviate skin conditions like rashes, eczema, and minor cuts.

title: Centella
description: Centella asiatica, also known as Gotu kola or Indian pennywort, is a small herbaceous plant with fan-shaped leaves. It's native to Asia and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
uses: Centella is known for its potential cognitive and skin health benefits. It is used in skincare products for its collagen-boosting and wound-healing properties. It's also believed to support mental clarity and memory in traditional medicine.

title: Chamomile
description: Chamomile is an herb with small, daisy-like flowers and a sweet, apple-like aroma. There are two common types: German chamomile and Roman chamomile, both of which have similar properties.
uses: Chamomile is well-known for its soothing and calming effects. It is often used to make herbal teas that can help with relaxation, sleep, and digestive issues. In skincare, chamomile is used for its anti-inflammatory properties and is found in various topical products.

title: Complex Bakuchiol + Ceramides
description: This complex likely combines Bakuchiol, a natural alternative to retinol known for its skin-rejuvenating properties, with Ceramides, which are lipid molecules naturally found in the skin's outer layer.
uses: This combination may provide anti-aging and skin barrier support. Bakuchiol can help reduce the appearance of wrinkles and fine lines, while ceramides help in maintaining skin hydration and integrity.

title: Complex Ginger + Caffeine
description: This complex likely combines Ginger extract, known for its anti-inflammatory properties, with Caffeine, a stimulant often used in skincare.
uses: This combination may help reduce skin redness and puffiness. Ginger can soothe irritated skin, while caffeine can temporarily tighten and firm the skin, making it appear more awake and refreshed.

title: Complex Keratin + Arginine + Biotin
description: This complex combines three key ingredients: Keratin, a protein that is a building block of hair and nails; Arginine, an amino acid; and Biotin, a B-vitamin.
uses: This combination is commonly found in haircare products and supplements. Keratin supports hair and nail strength, Arginine can improve blood circulation to the scalp, and Biotin is believed to promote hair and nail growth.

title: Complex Niacinamide + Zinc
description: This complex combines Niacinamide, a form of vitamin B3, with Zinc, a mineral.
uses: Niacinamide and Zinc are often used together in skincare products. Niacinamide can help reduce the appearance of enlarged pores, uneven skin tone, and fine lines. Zinc has anti-inflammatory properties and can help control oil production, making it suitable for acne-prone skin.

title: Complex Panthenol + Apple vinegar
description: This complex combines Panthenol, a provitamin of B5 known for its moisturizing properties, with Apple Vinegar, which is made from fermented apple juice.
uses: This combination may be used in skincare or haircare products. Panthenol can provide hydration and promote skin barrier repair, while apple vinegar may have exfoliating and clarifying properties when used in appropriate concentrations.

title: Complex Phyto collagen + Peptide
description: This complex combines Phyto Collagen, which is plant-derived collagen, with Peptides, which are short chains of amino acids.
uses: This combination is often used in skincare products. Phyto collagen and peptides are believed to help promote skin elasticity, reduce the appearance of wrinkles, and support overall skin health by providing amino acids and encouraging collagen production.

title: Complex Salicylic acid + B5
description: This complex combines Salicylic Acid, a beta hydroxy acid (BHA), with Vitamin B5, also known as Panthenol.
uses: This combination is common in skincare products designed for acne-prone or oily skin. Salicylic acid helps exfoliate the skin, unclog pores, and reduce acne, while Vitamin B5 provides hydration and supports skin barrier repair.

title: Complex Urea + Allantoin
description: This complex combines Urea, a naturally occurring compound found in the skin, with Allantoin, a soothing and moisturizing ingredient.
uses: Urea and Allantoin are often used in skincare products to provide hydration, soothe dry or irritated skin, and promote skin softness. They can be especially beneficial for individuals with dry or sensitive skin.

title: Honey
description: Honey is a natural sweet substance produced by bees from flower nectar. It has been used for centuries for its culinary and medicinal properties.
uses: Honey is used in skincare and wound care due to its natural antibacterial and moisturizing properties. It can help soothe and hydrate the skin, making it a popular ingredient in masks, creams, and lip balms.

title: Horse chestnut
description: Horse Chestnut is a tree native to Europe and is known for its distinctive, palmate leaves and spiky fruits.
uses: Extracts from horse chestnut seeds are commonly used in herbal remedies and skincare products. Horse chestnut is believed to have anti-inflammatory and vasoprotective properties, making it suitable for addressing conditions like varicose veins and leg swelling.

title: Hyaluron
description: Hyaluronic acid is a naturally occurring substance found in the skin, joints, and connective tissues. It is a powerful humectant, which means it can hold a large amount of water.
uses: Hyaluronic acid is commonly used in skincare products for its exceptional ability to hydrate and moisturize the skin. It helps improve skin texture, reduce the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles, and enhance overall skin suppleness.

title: Ichthyol + Sebo-stop complex
description: Ichthyol is a substance derived from shale deposits and is known for its anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. The Sebo-stop complex likely contains ingredients designed to control sebum production.
uses: This complex is often used in skincare products aimed at treating acne and oily skin. Ichthyol can help reduce inflammation, while sebum-regulating ingredients can control excess oil, preventing breakouts.

title: Panthenol
description: Panthenol, also known as Provitamin B5, is a water-soluble vitamin found in various foods. It is a precursor to vitamin B5 and is known for its skin-conditioning properties.
uses: Panthenol is used in skincare and haircare products for its ability to moisturize, soothe, and promote skin barrier repair. It is often included in creams, lotions, and shampoos to enhance skin and hair health.

title: Probiotic
description: Probiotics are live beneficial microorganisms, such as bacteria and yeast, that provide health benefits when consumed or applied topically.
uses: In skincare, probiotics are believed to help balance the skin's microbiome and promote a healthy skin barrier. They can be used in creams and serums to support skin health and address issues like redness and sensitivity.

title: Urea
description: Urea is a naturally occurring compound found in the skin and other bodily tissues. In skincare, synthetic urea is often used.
uses: Urea is a powerful humectant and moisturizer that helps retain water in the skin. It is commonly found in skincare products for dry and rough skin, as well as in treatments for conditions like eczema and psoriasis.

title: Vitamin C
description: Vitamin C, also known as ascorbic acid, is a water-soluble vitamin found in fruits and vegetables.
uses: In skincare, vitamin C is known for its antioxidant properties. It can help protect the skin from environmental damage, reduce the appearance of hyperpigmentation, promote collagen production, and brighten the complexion. It's commonly used in serums, creams, and lotions.
